phrase.cizu_name: half a loaf is better than no bread

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)it is better to accept less than one wants or expects than to have nothing at all

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English hlāf, of Germanic origin; related to German Laib
mid 19th cent.: probably a back-formation from loafer

entry.def: A loaf of bread is bread which has been shaped and baked in one piece. It is usually large enough for more than one person and can be cut into slices.
If you loaf, you stand or wait in a place, not doing anything interesting or useful.

means.word_mean: 1. a shaped mass of baked bread

sentences.sentence: "Her son is just bumming around all day"
"The high school students like to loiter in the Central Square"
"Who is this man that is hanging around the department?"

sentences.en: He bought two loaves of bread.

jushi.english: He bought two loaves of bread.
He was fired when he loafed on the job.
jushi.chinese: 他因工作不认真而被开除。

jushi.english: We loafed for hours along the water's edge.
jushi.chinese: 我们在水边闲谈了几个小时。
